doc: I am developing an application that uses neural networks.
It was successfully while the nd4j-native-platform was set in the pom file.
Then I tried to run using the GPU (I have a NVidia-610M graphics card), but there is a error that I cannot solve. The error is:

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4jBackend$NoAvailableBackendException: Please ensure that you have an nd4j backend on your classpath. Please see: http://nd4j.org/getstarted.html
Caused by: org.nd4j.linalg.factory.Nd4jBackend$NoAvailableBackendException: Please ensure that you have an nd4j backend on your classpath. Please see: http://nd4j.org/getstarted.html
As you can see, my cuda platform is correctly set. The output of the nvcc --version is
My pom file is pasted below:
<!-- Change the nd4j.backend property to nd4j-cuda-8.0-platform, nd4j-cuda-9.0-platform or nd4j-cuda-9.1-platform to use CUDA GPUs -->
<!-- For Spark examples: change the _1 to _2 to switch between Spark 1 and Spark 2 -->
<!-- Scala binary version: DL4J's Spark and UI functionality are released with both Scala 2.10 and 2.11 support -->
<hadoop.version>2.2.0</hadoop.version> <!-- Hadoop version used by Spark 1.6.3 and 2.2.1 (and likely others) -->
<!-- ND4J backend. You need one in every DL4J project. Normally define artifactId as either "nd4j-native-platform" or "nd4j-cuda-7.5-platform" -->
<!-- deeplearning4j-ui is used for visualization: see http://deeplearning4j.org/visualization -->
<!-- Next 2: used for MapFileConversion Example. Note you need *both* together -->
<!-- Arbiter - used for hyperparameter optimization (grid/random search) -->
<!-- datavec-data-codec: used only in video example for loading video data -->
<!-- Used in the feedforward/classification/MLP* and feedforward/regression/RegressionMathFunctions example -->
<!-- Used for downloading data in some of the examples -->
<message>You must set the environment variable JAVAFX_HOME to the installation directory of the JavaFX 2.0 SDK! (with Oracle JDK1.7, $JRE_HOME/lib/jfxrt.jar)</message>
<description>Project used for test the tcc's hypothesis</description>
